titleStmt.title: My lord, we the commons of London, in Common-Hall assembled, being deeply sensible that many of the mischiefs and grievances that we at present groan under are occasioned by the misbehaviour and irregular carriages of some of the principle officers of this city, particularly of Sir George Jefferies, Knight, our present record ...

notesStmt.note: Title from first six lines of the text.
Dated in ms. at bottom: 17. Octob. 1680.
Reproduction of original in Harvard University Library.
